Legal_Issue: Whether the Refugee Protection Division violated procedural fairness or demonstrated bias in rejecting the applicant's refugee claim
Governing_Law: Rules 29 and 30 of the Refugee Protection Division Rules, SOR/2002-228
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed bias due to late disclosure of exhibit R-5 and lack of a specified safe haven; no objection was made at the hearing; tribunal followed proper procedures
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the rejection of the refugee claim
Court_Ruling: No breach of procedural fairness or bias found
Defendant_Behavior: Refugee Protection Division conducted proceedings in accordance with rules
Legal_Standard: Principles of procedural fairness and natural justice
Procedural_Issue: Late disclosure of exhibit R-5, lack of objection during hearing
Credibility_Assessment: Memberâ€™s credibility findings were supported by evidence
Governing_Rule: Rules 29 and 30 of the Refugee Protection Division Rules
Cause_Description: Applicant challenged the rejection of his refugee claim citing procedural unfairness and bias
Evidence_Handling: Exhibit R-5 disclosed late but no objection raised
Decision_Rationale: No breach of procedural fairness or bias; credibility findings supported by evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Late disclosure of exhibit R-5 without timely objection
